solution_line_template: Since November has {total_days_in_november} days, the town received 4 inches of rain for the first half of the month for {total_days_in_november}/{first_period_divisor} = {first_period_days} days.

The total inches of rain that the town received for the {first_period_days} days is {first_period_days}*{daily_rainfall_first_period} = <<{first_period_days}*{daily_rainfall_first_period}={total_rainfall_first_period}>>{total_rainfall_first_period} inches.

The rain falling in the town increased by {rainfall_multiplier}*{daily_rainfall_first_period} = <<{rainfall_multiplier}*{daily_rainfall_first_period}={daily_rainfall_second_period}>>{daily_rainfall_second_period} inches per day for the remaining half of the month.

Therefore, for the rest of the month, the town received {daily_rainfall_second_period}*{first_period_days} = <<{daily_rainfall_second_period}*{first_period_days}={total_rainfall_second_period}>>{total_rainfall_second_period} inches of rain.

The total amount of rain the town received in November is {total_rainfall_second_period}+{total_rainfall_first_period} = <<{total_rainfall_second_period}+{total_rainfall_first_period}={total_rainfall_november}>>{total_rainfall_november} inches
